text: The 1966 San Diego State Aztecs football team represented San Diego State CollegeSan Diego State University was known as San Diego State College from 1935–1971. See: San Diego State during the 1966 NCAA College Division football season. San Diego State competed in the California Collegiate Athletic Association (CCAA). The team was led by head coach Don Coryell, in his sixth year, and played home games at both Aztec Bowl and Balboa Stadium. They finished the season as champions of the CCAA, undefeated and untied with eleven wins and zero losses (11–0, 5–0 CCAA). The Aztecs finished the season ranked number 1 in both the AP Small College Football Poll and the UPI Small College Football Poll. The offense scored 317 points during the season, while the defense only gave up 105. At the end of the regular season, San Diego State qualified for the Camellia Bowl, which at the time was the Western Regional Final in the College Division of the NCAA. The Aztecs beat Montana State in the game, 28–7. The Aztecs were voted the College Division national champion at the end of the season. ==Schedule== ==Team players in the NFL/AFL== The following San Diego State players were selected in the 1967 NFL Draft. {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Player || Position || Round || Overall || NFL team |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Don Horn || Quarterback || 1 || 25 || Green Bay Packers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Leo Carroll || Defensive end || 2 || 31 || Atlanta Falcons |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Don Shy || Running back || 2 || 35 || Pittsburgh Steelers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Bob Jones || Wide receiver || 2 || 36 || Chicago Bears |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Bob Howard || Defensive back || 2 || 48 || San Diego Chargers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Nate Johns || Flanker || 6 || 147 || San Diego Chargers |- align="center" bgcolor="" | John Williams || Defensive back || 7 || 174 || Philadelphia Eagles |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Craig Scoggins || End || 15 || 381 || San Diego Chargers |} ==Team awards== {|class="wikitable" width="65%" |- align="center" style="background:#A81933;color:#FFFFFF;" | Award || Player |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Most Valuable Player (John Simcox Memorial Trophy) || Don Horn |- align="center" bgcolor="" | Outstanding Offensive & Defensive Linemen (Byron H.
